import with alias.description: IMPORT a module using an alias. Warning: Shift + F12 will not work with alias

DATASET Workunit.description: From WUID: Dataset Definition from named output

Record Structure.description: Body of record structure layout for a dataset

record_full.description: Fully define a record structure layout for a dataset

project.description: Simple project to cast into new record structure with no custom mapping

iff.description: The IFF function performs the same functionality as IF, but ensures that an expression containing complex boolean logic is evaluated exactly as it appears.

map.description: The MAP function evaluates the list of expressions and returns the value associated with the first true expression. If none of them match, the elsevalue is returned. MAP may be thought of as an "IF ... ELSIF ... ELSIF ... ELSE" type of structure.

case.description: The CASE function evaluates the expression and returns the value whose caseval matches the expression result. If none match, it returns the elsevalue.

choose.description: The CHOOSE function evaluates the expression and returns the value parameter whose ordinal position in the list of parameters corresponds to the result of the expression. If none match, it returns the elsevalue. All values and the elsevalue must be of the same type.

dedup.description: Simple Dedup of a dataset by all columns in the record structure

Output File.description: Output a dataset to a logical file

Output First.description: Output the first 750 lines of a dataset for viewing

STD.File.CompareFiles.description: The CompareFiles function compares file1 against file2 and returns the following values

STD.File.DeleteLogicalFile.description: The DeleteLogicalFile function removes the named file from disk if exists

STD.File.LogicalFileList.description: The LogicalFileList function returns a list of the logical files in the environment files as a dataset in the format listed

STD.File.FileExists(.description: The FileExists function returns TRUE if the specified filename is present in the Distributed File Utility (DFU).

STD.File.ForeignLogicalFileName.description: The ForeignLogicalFileName function returns either a foreign logical file name

STD.File.GetLogicalFileAttribute.description: The GetLogicalFileAttribute function returns the value of the attrname for the specified logicalfilename.

STD.File.ProtectLogicalFile((.description: The ProtectLogicalFile function toggles protection on and off for the specified logicalfilename.

STD.File.RenameLogicalFile.description: The RenameLogicalFile function changes the logical filename to the newname

STD.File.SetFileDescription.description: The SetFileDescription function changes the description information stored by the DFU

STD.File.SetReadOnly.description: The SetReadOnly function toggles the read-only attribute of the filename. If the flag is TRUE, read-only is set on.

STD.File.VerifyFile.description: The VerifyFile function toggles the read-only attribute of the filename. If the flag is TRUE, read-only is set on.

STD.File.CreateSuperFile.description: The CreateSuperFile function creates an empty superfile. This function is not included in a superfile transaction

STD.File.SuperFileExists.description: The SuperFileExists function returns TRUE if the specified filename is present in the Distributed File Utility (DFU)

STD.File.DeleteSuperFile.description: The DeleteSuperFile function deletes the superfile

STD.File.GetSuperFileSubCount.description: The GetSuperFileSubCount function returns the number of sub-files comprising the superfile

STD.File.GetSuperFileSubName.description: The GetSuperFileSubName function returns the number of sub-files comprising the superfile

STD.File.LogicalFileSuperOwners.description: The LogicalFileSuperOwners function returns a list of the logical filenames of all the SuperFiles that contain the filename as a sub-file.

STD.File.LogicalFileSuperSubList.description: The LogicalFileSuperSubList function returns a list of the logical filenames of all the SuperFiles and their component sub-files

STD.File.SuperFileContents.description: The SuperFileContents function returns a list of the logical filenames of all the sub-files in the filename.

STD.File.FindSuperFileSubName.description: The FindSuperFileSubName function returns the ordinal position of the specified subfile in the superfile.

STD.File.StartSuperFileTransaction.description: The StartSuperFileTransaction function begins a transaction frame for superfile maintenance. The transaction frame is terminated by calling the FinishSuperFileTransaction function.

STD.File.AddSuperFile.description: The AddSuperFile function adds the subfile to the list of files comprising the superfile.

STD.File.RemoveSuperFile.description: The RemoveSuperFile function removes the subfile from the list of files comprising the superfile.

STD.File.ClearSuperFile.description: The ClearSuperFile function removes all sub-files from the list of files comprising the superfile.

STD.File.RemoveOwnedSubFiles.description: The RemoveOwnedSubFiles function removes all owned sub-files from the specified superfile.

STD.File.SwapSuperFile.description: The SwapSuperFile( function removes all owned sub-files from the specified superfile.

STD.File.ReplaceSuperFile.description: The ReplaceSuperFile function removes the subfile1 from the list of files comprising the superfile and replaces it with subfile2.

STD.File.FinishSuperFileTransaction.description: The FinishSuperFileTransaction function terminates a superfile maintenance transaction frame.

STD.File.MoveExternalFile.description: The MoveExternalFile function moves the single physical file specified by the frompath to the topath.

STD.File.DeleteExternalFile.description: The DeleteExternalFile function removes the single physical file specified by the path from the location.

STD.File.CreateExternalDirectory.description: The CreateExternalDirectory function creates the path on the location (if it does not already exist).

STD.File.RemoteDirectory.description: The RemoteDirectory function returns a list of files as a dataset in the format listed above from the specified

STD.File.Copy.description: The Copy function takes a logical file and copies it to another logical file. This may be done within the same cluster, or to another cluster, or to a cluster in a completely separate Dali

STD.File.CopyShort.description: Short: The Copy function takes a logical file and copies it to another logical file. This may be done within the same cluster, or to another cluster, or to a cluster in a completely separate Dali

STD.File.DeSpray.description: The DeSpray function takes a logical file and desprays it (combines all parts on each supercomputer node into a single physical file) to the landing zone

STD.File.RemotePull.description: The RemotePull function executes on the remoteURL, copying the sourcelogicalname from the local environment that instantiated the operation to the remote environment's destinationGroup cluster

STD.File.Replicate.description: The Replicate function copies the individual parts of the filename to the mirror disks for the cluster Typically this means that the file part on one nodes C drive is copied to its neighbors D drive

STD.File.SprayFixed.description: The SprayFixed function takes fixed-format file from the landing zone and distributes it across the nodes of the destination supercomputer

STD.File.SprayFixedShort.description: Short: The SprayFixed function takes fixed-format file from the landing zone and distributes it across the nodes of the destination supercomputer

STD.File.SprayDelimited.description: The SprayDelimited function takes a variable length file from the landing zone and distributes it across the nodes of the destination supercomputer

STD.File.SprayDelimitedSHORT.description: SHORT: The SprayDelimited function takes a variable length file from the landing zone and distributes it across the nodes of the destination supercomputer

STD.File.WaitDfuWorkunit.description: The WaitDfuWorkunit function waits for the specified DFU workunit to finish.

STD.Str.CleanSpaces.description: All variations of the CleanSpaces function return the source string with all instances of multiple adjacent space.

STD.Uni.CompareAtStrength.description: The CompareAtStrength functions return zero (0) if the source1 and source2 strings contain the same data

STD.Str.CompareIgnoreCase.description: The CompareIgnoreCase functions return zero (0) if the source1 and source2 strings contain the same data

STD.Str.Contains.description: The Contains functions return true if all the characters in the pattern appear in the source, otherwise they return false.

STD.Str.CountWords.description: The CountWords function returns the number of words in the source string based on the specified separator.

STD.Str.DecodeBase64.description: The DecodeBase64 function returns a DATA value containing the decoded binary data.

STD.Str.EncodeBase64.description: The EncodeBase64 function returns a STRING containing the binary data encoded in Base64.

STD.Str.EndsWith.description: The EndsWith function returns TRUE if the src ends with the text in the suffix parameter.

STD.Str.EqualIgnoreCase.description: The EqualIgnoreCase function return TRUE if the source1 and source2 strings contain the same data, ignoring any case of letters.

STD.Str.ExcludeFirstWord.description: The ExcludeFirstWord function returns the text string with the first word removed

STD.Str.ExcludeLastWord.description: The ExcludeLastWord function returns the text string with the Last word removed

STD.Str.ExcludeNthWord.description: The ExcludeNthWord function returns the text string with the nth word removed

STD.Str.Extract.description: The Extract function returns the data at the ordinal position specified by the instance

STD.Str.Filter.description: The StringFilter functions return the source string with all the characters except those in the filterstring removed

STD.Str.FilterOut.description: The FilterOut functions return the source string with all the characters in the filterstring removed

STD.Str.Find.description: The Find functions return the source string with all the characters in the filterstring removed

STD.Str.FindCount.description: The FindCount function returns the number of non-overlapping instances of the sought string within the src string.

STD.Str.FindReplace.description: The FindReplace function returns the number of non-overlapping instances of the sought string within the src string.

STD.Str.FindWord.description: The FindWord functions return TRUE if the word string is found in src string..

STD.Str.Reverse.description: The Reverse functions return the source string with all characters in reverse order.

STD.Str.SplitWords.description: The SplitWords function returns the list of words in the src string split out by the specified separator.

STD.Str.StartsWith.description: The StartsWith function returns TRUE if the src starts with the text in the prefix parameter

STD.Str.ToLowerCase.description: The ToLowerCase functions return the source string with all upper case characters converted to lower case

STD.Str.ToTitleCase.description: The ToTitleCase functions return the source string with the first letter of each word in upper case and all other letters lower case

STD.Str.ToUpperCase.description: The ToUpperCase functions return the source string with all lower case characters converted to upper case

STD.Str.Translate.description: The Translate functions return the src string with the replacement character substituted for all characters in the src

STD.Str.WildMatch.description: The WildMatch functions return the src string with the replacement character substituted for all characters in the src

STD.Str.WordCount.description: The WordCount function returns the number of words in the source string.

STD.Date.Year.description: The Year function returns the Year number from the date value..

STD.Date.Month.description: The Month function returns the month number from the date value

STD.Date.Day.description: The Day function returns the Day number from the date value

STD.Date.Hour.description: The Hour function returns the hour from the time value

STD.Date.Minute.description: The Minute function returns the minute from the time value.

STD.Date.Second.description: The Second function returns the second from the time value.

STD.Date.TimeFromParts.description: The TimeFromParts function returns a Date_t value from the hour, minute, and second parameters

STD.Date.DateFromParts.description: The DateFromParts function returns a Date_t value from the year, month, and day parameters

STD.Date.IsLeapYear.description: The IsLeapYear function returns TRUE if the year is a leap year in the Gregorian (or proleptic Gregorian) calendar

STD.Date.IsDateLeapYear.description: The IsDateLeapYear function returns TRUE if the year represented in the date is a leap year in the Gregorian

STD.Date.IsValidDate.description: The IsValidDate function returns TRUE if the date is valid, both by range-checking the year and by validating

STD.Date.IsValidTime.description: The IsValidTime function returns TRUE if the time is valid, by validating each of the individual components

STD.Date.FromStringToDate.description: The FromStringToDate function converts a string to a Date_t using the relevant string format

STD.Date.IsValidGregorianDate.description: The IsValidGregorianDate function returns TRUE if the date is valid in the Gregorian calendar.

STD.Date.CurrentDate.description: The CurrentDate function returns the current date. If the in_local_time parameter is TRUE the returned value is local

STD.Date.CurrentTime.description: The CurrentTime function returns the current time. If the in_local_time parameter is TRUE the returned value is local to the cluster computing the time, if FALSE then the UTC is returned

STD.Date.DayOfWeek.description: The DayOfWeek function returns a number representing the day of the week for the given date

STD.Date.DayOfYear.description: The DayOfYear function returns a number representing the day of the year for the given date.

STD.Date.DaysBetween.description: The DaysBetween function calculates the number of whole days between two dates

STD.Date.MonthsBetween.description: The MonthsBetween function calculates the number of whole months between two dates

STD.Date.STD.Date.AdjustDate.description: The AdjustDate function adjusts a date by incrementing or decrementing year, month, and/or day values. The date must be in the Gregorian calendar after the year 1600

STD.System.Group.description: The Group function returns the name of the node group running the workunit.This name is used in ECL code to specify the target CLUSTER for an OUTPUT action or a PERSISTed attribute

STD.System.DaliServer.description: The Daliserver function returns the IP and port of the system data store (Dali) server for the environment running the workunit

STD.File.GetEspUrl.description: The GetEspUrl function returns the full URL to an ESP server process.

STD.System.Debug.Sleep.description: The Sleep function pauses processing for duration milliseconds.

Short:STD.System.Email.SendEmail.description: SHORT:The SendEmail function sends an email message.

STD.System.Email.SendEmail.description: The SendEmail function sends an email message.

Short:STD.System.Email.SendEmailAttachDa.description: Short:The SendEmailAttachData function sends an email message with a binary attachment..

STD.System.Email.SendEmailAttachData.description: The SendEmailAttachData function sends an email message with a binary attachment..

Short:STD.System.Email.SendEmailAttachTe.description: Short:The SendEmailAttachText function sends an email message with a text attachment..

STD.System.Email.SendEmailAttachText.description: The SendEmailAttachText function sends an email message with a text attachment..

IN_Operator.description: The IN operator is shorthand for a collection of OR conditions.

BETWEEN_Operator.description: The BETWEEN operator is shorthand for an inclusive range check using standard comparison operators.

Value Types Boolean.description: A Boolean true/false value. TRUE and FALSE are reserved ECL keywords

Value Types INTEGER.description: An n-byte integer value. Valid values for n are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,or 8. If n is not specified for the INTEGER

Simple Value Types INTEGER.description: Simple: An n-byte integer value. Valid values for n are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,or 8. If n is not specified for the INTEGER

Value Types REAL.description: An n-byte standard IEEE floating point value. Valid values for n are: 4 (values to 7 significant digits) or 8

Simple Value Types REAL.description: Simple: An n-byte standard IEEE floating point value. Valid values for n are: 4 (values to 7 significant digits) or 8

Value Types DECIMAL.description: A packed decimal value of n total digits (to a maximum of 32). If the _y value is present, the y defines the number of decimal places in the value

Simple Value Types DECIMAL.description: Simple:A packed decimal value of n total digits (to a maximum of 32). If the _y value is present, the y defines the number of decimal places in the value

Value Types STRING.description: A character string of n bytes, space padded (not null-terminated). If n is omitted, the string is variable length to the size needed to contain the result of the cast or passed parameter. The upper size limit for any STRING value is 4GB.

Value Types QSTRING.description: A data-compressed variation of STRING that uses only 6-bits per character to reduce storage requirements for large strings. The character set is limited to capital letters A-Z, the numbers 0-9, the blank space, and the following set of special characters: ! " # $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / ; < = > ? @ [ \ ] ^ _ The upper size limit for any STRING value is 4GB.

Value Types DATA.description: A (packed hexadecimal) data block of n bytes, zero padded (not space-padded). If n is omitted, the DATA is variable. The upper size limit for any DATA value is 4GB.

Value Types VARSTRING.description: A null-terminated character string containing n bytes of data.. If n is omitted, the DATA is variable. The upper size limit for any DATA value is 4GB.

Value Types SET OF.description: The SET OF value type defines Attributes that are a set of data elements. All elements of the set must be of the same yype.

Value Types TYPEOF.description: The TYPEOF declaration allows you to define an Attribute or parameter whose value type is (just like) the expression

Value Types RECORDOF.description: The RECORDOF declaration specifies use of just the record layout of the recordset in those situations where you need to inherit the structure of the fields but not their default values, such as child DATASET declarations

body: ${1|Intersection:R1 AND R2,Union:R1 OR R2,Difference:R1 AND NOT R2,Exception:R1 AND NOT F1,Exception:R1 AND NOT [F1, F2]|}
Field Inheritance.description: Inheritance of a Layout of a dataset

Dedup_Sort_Distibute.description: Distribute Sort and Dedup a dataset
